meanings.definition: A person who has aphasia, a language disorder that affects the ability to communicate.
meanings.sent1: The support group welcomed new aphasiacs with open arms.
meanings.sent2: The hospital had a specialized program to help aphasiacs improve their communication skills.
meanings.sent3: During the game of charades, the aphasiacs had everyone laughing with their creative gestures.
meanings.sent4: In a world of text messages and emails, aphasiacs navigate a different language.
meanings.sent5: The documentary shed light on the challenges faced by aphasiacs in everyday conversations.

meanings.sent1: The clinic was filled with aphasiacs seeking treatment.
meanings.sent2: The researchers conducted a study involving various aphasiacs to understand their experiences.
meanings.sent3: At the conference, the aphasiacs formed a lively discussion group.
meanings.sent4: In the library, shelves were filled with books written by aphasiacs.
meanings.sent5: The community center organized an event to raise awareness about the needs of aphasiacs.
